alert.note: Alert for Scott (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 20 at 8:55PM CDT until July 21 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Dodge City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Dodge City has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Scott County in west central Kansas... * Until midnight CDT. * At 855 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen and 1 to 2 inches fell from earlier thunderstorms this afternoon. The expected rainfall rate is 1 to 2 inches in 1 hour. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Scott City, Shallow Water, Modoc, Grigston, Manning and Scott State Lake. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-2 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
